page.title: 02Cameley Vale Settlement
page.content: With a population of approximately 1000 Temple Cloud is the largest centre of population.It grew as a linear village along the Bristol-Wells road.In 1901 the population of the parish was 403,having fallen from 643 in 1841.During the last 20 years there has been Local Authority and private housing development,accomodating Bristol overspill and commuter families.Temple Cloud is identified as a 'centre for growth' in the County Structure Plan,so further growth is anticipated. The oldest building in the parish is Cameley church,while Cameley mill dates from the seventeenth century.Many houses are made of the locally quarried Temple Stone.1985 saw the opening of the village hall.Both the village pub and St. Barnabas' Church,in Temple, are twentieth cent.
